reply: 16951692, Ixcatl means cotton, it is a Nahuatl word. By adding the ending zin, the word becomes a proper name. Ixcatzin was the name I chose when I was learning Nahutal, since my name (Raquel) means ewe. Amerindians did not own any sheep, so I chose cotton. See ya after Shabbat. Raquel

content: I ask you again...don't you care? Of course I care!! Don't you?? Before you approach someone about questions of faith, you MUST first ascertain if they want to hear it!! To go into a contested society and start to "spread the word", for want of a better term, you had best determine if it will get you, or others, killed!! Now, once the conflict has ended and cooler heads prevail, THEN you can talk religion....IF, that is IF, they want to hear it!! AND!! After you have PROVED your intentions and actions as a good Christian should, so they approach you wanting what it is you have, not the other way around. Otherwise respect their choices and leave it alone!! This is why Christians have such a reputation as arrogant azzes!! We assume everybody is hell bound if they are not one of us. When our own book tells us, "They who have never heard My Name serve Me, and their names are written in the book of life." SO, if God has a problem with them, HE will fix it NOT you. Now I am an ordained Christian Minister and a good one, not to be falsly humble, but I would NEVER make someone feel their religion is not as good as mine. That kind of thinking, you keep to yourself!! Down that road lies madness, injury and death, for millions!! Always has, always will!! Rev. Bruce.....Tawodi

I wouldn't be surprised if it was just swept under the rug though.

content: I ask you again...don't you care? Of course I care!! Don't you?? Before you approach someone about questions of faith, you MUST first ascertain if they want to hear it!! To go into a contested society and start to "spread the word", for want of a better term, you had best determine if it will get you, or others, killed!! Now, once the conflict has ended and cooler heads prevail, THEN you can talk religion....IF, that is IF, they want to hear it!! AND!! After you have PROVED your intentions and actions as a good Christian should, so they approach you wanting what it is you have, not the other way around. Otherwise respect their choices and leave it alone!! This is why Christians have such a reputation as arrogant azzes!! We assume everybody is hell bound if they are not one of us. When our own book tells us, "They who have never heard My Name serve Me, and their names are written in the book of life." SO, if God has a problem with them, HE will fix it NOT you. Now I am an ordained Christian Minister and a good one, not to be falsly humble, but I would NEVER make someone feel their religion is not as good as mine. That kind of thinking, you keep to yourself!! Down that road lies madness, injury and death, for millions!! Always has, always will!! Rev. Bruce.....Tawodi

content: I ask you again...don't you care? Of course I care!! Don't you?? Before you approach someone about questions of faith, you MUST first ascertain if they want to hear it!! To go into a contested society and start to "spread the word", for want of a better term, you had best determine if it will get you, or others, killed!! Now, once the conflict has ended and cooler heads prevail, THEN you can talk religion....IF, that is IF, they want to hear it!! AND!! After you have PROVED your intentions and actions as a good Christian should, so they approach you wanting what it is you have, not the other way around. Otherwise respect their choices and leave it alone!! This is why Christians have such a reputation as arrogant azzes!! We assume everybody is hell bound if they are not one of us. When our own book tells us, "They who have never heard My Name serve Me, and their names are written in the book of life." SO, if God has a problem with them, HE will fix it NOT you. Now I am an ordained Christian Minister and a good one, not to be falsly humble, but I would NEVER make someone feel their religion is not as good as mine. That kind of thinking, you keep to yourself!! Down that road lies madness, injury and death, for millions!! Always has, always will!! Rev. Bruce.....Tawodi

content: The top brass actually already stopped this. The story is from about a year ago. Those Pashto and Dari New Testaments were confiscated before they could be distributed to the locals, and the Army announced there could be disciplinary action against some of those seen in the video. Coaching subordinates on how to circumvent orders is serious business. The chaplains certainly should have been officially reprimanded at least, but so far I haven't been able to find out if that was done or not. I wouldn't be surprised if it was just swept under the rug though.

content: Every day I pray for the peace of Jerusalem and take seriously G-d's promise to bless those who bless Israel. I don't know exactly why G-d said this and do not defend the actions of G-d's people, whose souls I love as, with G-d's help, I do yours. We really are blessed...life, health, home, family etc...but realize G-d could take as He has given. Well, here's one last thought: G-d loves to bless and only asks we remember to say, "Thank you." content: I ask you again...don't you care? Of course I care!! Don't you?? Before you approach someone about questions of faith, you MUST first ascertain if they want to hear it!! To go into a contested society and start to "spread the word", for want of a better term, you had best determine if it will get you, or others, killed!! Now, once the conflict has ended and cooler heads prevail, THEN you can talk religion....IF, that is IF, they want to hear it!! AND!! After you have PROVED your intentions and actions as a good Christian should, so they approach you wanting what it is you have, not the other way around. Otherwise respect their choices and leave it alone!! This is why Christians have such a reputation as arrogant azzes!! We assume everybody is hell bound if they are not one of us. When our own book tells us, "They who have never heard My Name serve Me, and their names are written in the book of life." SO, if God has a problem with them, HE will fix it NOT you. Now I am an ordained Christian Minister and a good one, not to be falsly humble, but I would NEVER make someone feel their religion is not as good as mine. That kind of thinking, you keep to yourself!! Down that road lies madness, injury and death, for millions!! Always has, always will!! Rev. Bruce.....Tawodi
